intro.p1: In Orange County, mailbox projects are often driven by large master-planned communities, higher-density apartments and mixed-use properties, and the need to keep shared mail areas aligned with current USPS and ADA standards. Postal Systems installs and replaces commercial mailbox systems for HOAs, apartments, and commercial properties across key Orange County markets.
intro.p2: We manage the full scope for Orange County properties: reviewing your existing mailbox layout, recommending USPS-approved equipment, installing concrete pads and anchors, and coordinating USPS inspections so boards, managers, and owners have one accountable contractor from start to finish.

commonProjects: New cluster box units for HOAs and townhome communities in Orange County master-planned neighborhoods.
4C wall-mounted mailrooms for mid-rise apartments and mixed-use buildings in more urbanized areas of Orange County.
Parcel locker additions at communities where package volume has outgrown traditional mailbox configurations.
Mailbox replacements at properties where existing boxes are sun-faded, damaged, or no longer meet USPS expectations.
ADA-focused upgrades to improve reach, height, and approach clearances at shared mailbox locations throughout Orange County.
whoWeWorkWith: HOAs and community associations throughout Orange County.
Apartment and multi-family communities managed by local and regional management firms.
Builders and general contractors on new residential and mixed-use developments.
Owners and managers of commercial and industrial parks across Orange County.
Schools, campuses, and municipal facilities serving Orange County residents.

faqs.question: Do you handle mailbox projects for multiple communities within Orange County?
faqs.answer: Yes. We work with HOAs, apartments, and commercial properties across Orange County, coordinating layouts, equipment selection, and USPS approvals for each site. Our goal is to provide consistent, code-compliant mailbox solutions even when projects span multiple communities.

faqs.question: What mailbox systems do you typically recommend for Orange County properties?
faqs.answer: Most Orange County properties use USPS-approved CBUs or 4C wall-mounted mailboxes, often with parcel lockers to handle package volume. We evaluate your property layout, resident needs, and USPS guidelines to recommend the equipment and configuration that best fits your site.

faqs.question: How do you coordinate with boards and managers during a mailbox project in Orange County?
faqs.answer: We provide boards and managers with a clear sequence of steps, from site visit and proposal through installation and USPS inspection. For Orange County projects, we also supply timelines and suggested notices so residents know what to expect and when new keys will be available.
